interestingFact: India officially surpassed China as the world's most populous country in 2023.
China is experiencing its first population decline in decades due to low birth rates and an aging demographic.
Growth in the U.S. is primarily driven by international migration rather than natural increase.
Indonesia is the world's largest island nation and has a significant youth demographic.
Pakistan has one of the fastest-growing populations in the world, with a very young median age.
Nigeria is Africa's most populous country and is projected to reach half a billion people by 2100.
Brazil is the largest country in South America, though its population growth has begun to slow.
Bangladesh is one of the most densely populated countries, known for its industrious manufacturing workforce.
Despite being the largest country by area, Russia's population is currently in decline.
Ethiopia is one of the fastest-growing nations in Africa, with a majority of its population under age 20.
Mexico City is one of the largest metropolitan areas in the world by population.
Japan has the world's oldest median age and has seen its population shrink for several consecutive years.
Most of Egypt's population is concentrated along the banks of the Nile River.
The Philippines is an archipelago where rapid urbanization is a major demographic trend.
The Democratic Republic of the Congo has one of the highest fertility rates globally.
Vietnam reached the 100 million population milestone in 2023.
Iran has a highly urbanized population, with the majority living in major cities like Tehran.
Turkey serves as a major demographic and geographic bridge between Europe and Asia.
Germany has the largest population in the European Union but faces significant aging challenges.
Tanzania is experiencing rapid growth and is expected to nearly double its population by 2050.
